ovdesc.p: This file defines all the schedules which are permitted on a Swap contract.
All schedules are defined on the contract for both legs, Asset (AS.TYPE) and Liability (LB.TYPE).
The first two characters of the Id of the record determine the type of schedules and are fixed as follows :

o AC Interest accrual current month o AM Interest accrual previous month o AY Interest accrual previous year o CI Contract initiation (contingent movements) o CM Contract maturity o PX Principal exchange o RX Principal re-exchange o PI Principal increase o PD Principal decrease o IP Interest payment o RR Rate reset o PM Payment (premium, interest purchased etc.) o RV Receipt (premium, interest received etc.) o IS Issue price o AP Annuity payment
Different schedules can be defined but the first two characters must be one of the above. Eg. "PMPR" = Payment of Premium.
The following schedule types are system generated schedules and cannot be defined on the contract by the user :
o AC Accrual current month o AM Accrual previous month o AY Accrual previous year o CI Contract initiation o CM Contract maturity
For each schedule defined, the following associated information is also held :
o Transaction code (Mandatory except CI,CM,RR; must be unique if IS) o Profit & Loss Category code (Mandatory if PM,RV,IS) o Charge code o Fee code o Enrichment description.

2 to 6 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory input).
The first two characters must be one of the fixed swap type definitions. The remainder characters are of free format.
Defines the Category code to be used on entries for the associated Swap schedule type.
This P&L Category code is for :
o P&L debit entries for PM schedules only or, o P&L credit entries for RV schedules only.
Category codes are used within the T24 system to classify financial transactions according to the type of business operation or product.
